[R] Language models can now teach themselves HOW to use tools (i.e any API) in real time, completely automated. Debug is a brand new high quality print magazine focused entirely on indie games, from solo devs right up to the so called triple-i studios.

If you ever read Sega Power or Saturn Power in the 90s, you’ll already know the editor Dean Mortlock.

Got something you’re working on and want to share? https://www.teamdebug.com and let us know!

title: GitHub - coolbutuseless/deft: R package providing C functions for creating/expanding data.frames from within C

last_post.content:
Introducing {deft} - code for creating data.frames within C and returning to user.

Benchmarks show creating totally within C can be *FAST*!

~100x faster than creating data.frames with tibble() or data.frame()

https://github.com/coolbutuseless/deft

This is designed to be used as a 'LinkingTo' package, so that I can use these functions as part of a bigger project.

#RStats

Heard about this today on the Radio National program “Future Tense”, and I haven’t had much chance yet to try it out, but it looks potentially like a lot of fun.

https://weird-old-book-finder.glitch.me

title: GitHub - coolbutuseless/deftly: Demonstration of using the C data.frame functions in the {deft} package.

last_post.content:
And I only figured out today how to properly(?) call C code from one package in another package.

So I wrote {deftly} package as a reminder to myself how this works with:

* Set LinkingTo: deft
* Set Depends: deft
* #include <deft.h>

And how to write a correct deft.h and exporting of C callables from {deft}'s init.c

All this came from studying how {systemfonts} package works.

{deftly} just imports and calls the C code from {deft}

https://github.com/coolbutuseless/deftly

#RStats

title: A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you

last_post.content:
A new study about seabirds and offshore wind turbines may surprise you.

A two-year, €3 million study of seabirds at an offshore wind farm off Scotland combined radar data with cameras to identify the species of seabird and create a three-dimensional image of birds’ flight patterns and how they avoid offshore wind turbines’ rotor blades.

The study’s findings: Not a single collision between a bird and a rotor blade was recorded.

https://electrek.co/2023/03/02/seabirds-and-offshore-wind-turbines-vattenfall/

I love Pandas! I've been using it ever since I started doing machine learning more than a decade ago.

Now that the Pandas 2.0 release candidate is out, I was just taking the new PyArrow backend for a test drive. It's a significant boost over the original NumPy backend.
For string manipulation, it even seems faster than polars.

Code for reference here:
https://github.com/rasbt/machine-learning-notes/blob/main/benchmark/pandas-pyarrow/pandas2-pyarrow.ipynb

Pooch v1.7.0 is out! 🐶

Now you can download files from https://dataverse.org DOIs, automatically populate Pooch's registry from DOI repositories, and more!

We now support Zenodo repositories that were created using the GitHub integration service, and we fixed a bug with figshare archives not fetching the desired version of the files.

Full list of changes: https://www.fatiando.org/pooch/v1.7.0/changes.html

Big thanks to all the new contributors 👏

title: An historical perspective on low back pain and disability - PubMed

last_post.content:
Let's look at that citation.

The cited paper has nothing to do with the claims that baby bear is associating with it.

It's not a paper about spinal evolution in our hominin ancestors, it's a paper about back pain in modern human history.

Once again, large language models don't have underlying knowledge models, and in their current forms don't even understand the relations among documents.

Why anyone would think this makes for a good search engine is beyond me.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2533783/
Now over on Itch, 74 and 74a of Lair W PX, in which I get stuck in texture studies and things get out of hand. Available on Itch IO at: https://wetdryvac.itch.io/

I want the cis people in my followers list to see this.

Just this weekend, in the US, at the Conservative Political Action Conference, one of the speakers at the event called for the eradication of trans people from daily life.

Eradication. There were no euphemisms, just an outright call for genocide.

That is where we are heading.

Australia is lucky. We aren't as far down that pipeline as the US, but we are going that way.

The trans people in your life are terrified. We need your help, we need your voices. This isn't a theoretical issue, or a future issue. It's right here, and it's right now.

Help us

#trans #transgender #uspol #pol #auspol

title: Pluralistic: Solving the Moderator’s Trilemma with Federation (04 Mar 2023) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
#MastodonMedia Mar 4, 2023

The Fediverse has a vital inherent structural advantage. Alan Rozenshtein, U of Minn Law, calls it "content-moderation subsidiarity." Cory Doctorow expounds on this in:

@pluralistic: Solving the Moderator's Trilemma with Federation >>> https://pluralistic.net/2023/03/04/pick-all-three/#agonism

"The fact that users can leave a server and set up somewhere else means that when a user gets pissed off enough... they can simply choose another server that's part of the same federation."

title: Dr. Valerie L. Thomas: The Face Behind Landsat Images

last_post.content:
Meet the woman behind early @NASA_Landsat images: Dr. Valerie L. Thomas.

A self-taught programmer, she managed the development of Landsat image processing. Her work in the '70s helped show that satellite imagery could be used to support agriculture. https://www.nasa.gov/image-feature/dr-valerie-l-thomas-the-face-behind-landsat-images/ #BHM

Being trans online is watching everyone else have to do crowdfunding until you're the one doing it, and it's my turn. This is a moving fund one of my friends set up for me. WHAT THIS WILL ALLOW ME TO DO: Move out of the Bay Area, which has no housing mobility, and is an increasingly-untenable living situation. Moving to Philly will allow me to get better healthcare as a trans person, move in with my partner, and be in proximity to a support network. https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-fox-and-zelda-move-in-together

title: School Streets Programs Surging In Some Cities But Others Have More Homework To Do

last_post.content:
“School streets” programs have been growing in many countries. These Open Streets programs are designed to provide safe spaces for children to engage in healthier mobility and physical activity, such as walking or biking, by temporarily closing streets near schools to car traffic.

The benefits to kids, to everyone, are well documented.

#OpenStreets #cars #cities #streets #schools

https://momentummag.com/school-streets-programs/

title: The Next Deadly Pandemic Is Just a Forest Clearing Away

last_post.content: "The next deadly pandemic is just a forest clearing away. But we’re not even trying to prevent it." https://www.propublica.org/article/pandemic-spillover-outbreak-guinea-forest-clearing "Models have shown that the more patchy a forest gets, the more edges are created at the borders of clearings where virus-carrying animals can come into contact with humans, until so much forest is cut down that it can’t sustain wildlife anymore. The theoretical model encapsulates this concept to assess risk by considering the amount of “edge” produced by deforestation"

title: What the Dogs of Chernobyl Could Tell Us About Living on Mars

last_post.content:
The wild dogs of Chernobyl are the descendants of pets that were left behind when people were forced to evacuate in the wake of the nuclear disaster 37 years ago.

Studying how they have been affected by their radioactive environment could help humans live on Mars.

#Mars #radiation

https://www.inverse.com/science/what-the-dogs-of-cherynobyl-could-tell-us-about-living-on-mars

title: APOD: 2023 March 4 - 10 Days of Venus and Jupiter

last_post.content: "10 Days of Venus and Jupiter" is #NASA #astronomy pic of the day APoD - side-by-side images of Venus & Jupiter, the brightest planets in the sky, nearly lining up from Earth's field of view. Venus is closer to the Sun. Jupiter was headed behind it. https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap230304.html

title: How Bush's grandfather helped Hitler's rise to power

last_post.content:
@JohnShirley2023
George Bush's grandfather, the late US senator Prescott Bush, was a director and shareholder of companies that profited from their involvement with the financial backers of Nazi Germany.
His business dealings, which continued until his company's assets were seized in 1942.

title: GitHub - FahimF/FediJS: A pure JavaScript Fediverse client

last_post.content:
After a conversation with somebody on here about Mastodon clients and filtering, I cleaned up my JavaScript Mastodon client code and put it up here:

https://github.com/FahimF/FediJS

It’s pure JavaScript — no libraries, no dependencies … except for FontAwesome and BootStrap. And my original aim was to keep the code simple and uncomplicated.

It doesn’t do much at the moment except to allow you to connect to a Fedi server and to fetch posts (and maybe favourites and bookmarks? I forget …)

I was fixing an issue in my variation of Tusker today (where going several levels deep into a conversation would cause a crash) and I realized just how far I’d have to go to get the JavaScript client to that level. It probably would be easier in some respects and having the code as JavaScript would mean that it would run on so many different platforms, but do I have the fortitude to work on yet another client?

I’m not sure … But I do feel the itch to actually finish the JS Client … I guess we’ll see …

title: Alaska Says It’s Now Legal “in Some Instances” to Discriminate Against LGBTQ Individuals

last_post.content:
When Alaska rolled back its protections for LGBTQ people, it didn't send out a press release.

Instead, the state quietly announced the policy change via the social media feeds of its human rights commission.

The agency's Twitter and Facebook accounts had a total of 102 followers as of yesterday.

New, from @ProPublica & Anchorage Daily News:

https://www.propublica.org/article/alaska-drops-lgbtq-discrimination-ban?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=mastodon-post

#Alaska #LGBTQ #CivilRights #HumanRights #SCOTUS #Employment #Discrimination #Housing #Credit

last_post.content:
#JudithHeumann, the mother of the American #disability rights movement, has died. It is safe to say that without her advocacy we would still be waiting for all of the legislative and regulatory progress that protects our rights and access to schools, workplaces and public accommodations.

May her memory be for a blessing and a revolution.
